page.title: 05Gloucester Cattle Market.
page.content: Top prices for Bulls are Friesian Â£760.00 Hereford Â£690.00 Charolais Â£635.00 C.I. Â£302.00 half of these are sold for slaughter and another half for fattening and breeding.Of those that go for slaughter most go to local butchers,but some go to Birmingham and for export.Breeding/fattening animals are sent all over the country. The animal they sell most of in the Market is sheep but they make the most money from cattle.About 318,000 animals go through the Market each year.The most important markets are held in Spring and Autumn,and the one with the longest history is the Barton Fair Market,mainly a sheep market held in Autumn.
